concept.title: Unified Keystore Overview
concept.shortdesc: The Unified Keystore provides a unified view of all the keystores in a device.

section.title: Introduction
section.p: The Unified Keystore provides an interface to access keys in various keystore implementations in the device. Symbian provides a default keystore implementation. Device creators may include Symbian's keystore implementation in a device and may add their own keystores.

section.title: Keystore functionality
section.p: The Unified Keystore API provides the following functionality:
These tasks are performed differently depending on the keystore version being used.
The Symbian keystore supports access control to the keystore using application UIDs. There are two modes of access:

li.p: Owner: As key owners, applications can create, delete and manage keys.
User: As key users, application can view and retrieve keys but cannot perform any modification operations.
For details on the Unified Keystore functionality, refer to the Unified Keystore Tutorials.
The CUnifiedKeyStore class provides functions for performing the various keystore operations.
